intro: Neotina coursii, commonly known as the Corsican neotina, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Neotina coursii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
